setting.conf_title_desc: This section allows you to manage your cookie settings.

setting.conf_description: Use .domain.com for site wide cookies
Useful if you have multiple installations on one URL.

setting.conf_title_desc: This section allows you to comply with COPPA.

setting.conf_description: Enabling COPPA on your board will require children under the age of 13 to get parental consent via a faxed or mailed form.

setting.conf_title: Fax number to receive COPPA forms
Mail address to receive COPPA forms

setting.conf_description: This text will be displayed on the parental consent form and can be used to include your privacy policy (a requirement for COPPA compliance)

setting.conf_title_desc: This section allows certain features to be limited or removed to get more performance out of your board.

setting.conf_description:
Will display 'busy' message when limit hit
Can be left blank for no limit
Some web accelerators can "prefetch" pages before users request them. Will feel faster for the user if the page is then requested, but can waste server resources if it isn't.
Enter the number of days to cache content (posts and members' signatures). Enter 0 to disable caching.
If 'yes', then content set out below will be cached to save resources.
If 'yes' then a record will be kept of cached versus raw items served. Warning: Do not enable during busy periods, recommend for sampling for short periods only.
Enter the number of days to cache posts for. Enter 0 to not cache.
Enter the number of days to cache members' signatures for. Enter 0 to not cache.

setting.conf_title: Allow custom profile field info be used in TopicView?
setting.conf_description: If set to "yes", this will add a LEFT JOIN onto the custom profile field table.
Not recommended if your board isn't visited daily.

setting.conf_title: Cut off for active user display [in minutes]

setting.conf_description: If allowed, IP.Board will attempt to determine the 'watched' status of forums and topics and change the link accordingly. This uses 1 table join (indexed) per topic view and 1 indexed query per forum view.

If enabled, the topic views counter will be updated as one loads a topic. If not enabled, the topic views will be written to another table and the topic views updated every 3 hours. This will significantly reduce overhead on the topics table if you have a very busy board as it overcomes the write lock initiated when the topic counter is updated.

setting.conf_title: Mark topics a user has posted when displaying a forum?

setting.conf_description: Number of seconds after a search has started that IPB should try to kill the query if the user has left the page. Enter 0 to disable.
This save 1 query per forum view
(This save 1 query per topic view)
Do you wish to disable the topic summary from displaying at the bottom of the post reply page?

setting.conf_title: Allow users (where allowed) to use search?
Allow search results to be grouped
setting.conf_description: This enables the "show results as titles" option on the search form, however the resulting query can lock up the posts table. Only enable if searching posts and titles while displaying the results as titles is important to your site.
Show the board totals at the footer of the board index page.
Member statistics related to forum activity displayed in the profile can be resource intensive on larger sites.

setting.conf_title: No. characters to word wrap on?
setting.conf_description: Prevents long unbroken words which distort tables. 80 - 150 is recommended if enabling, but this process can be slow.
Do you wish to disable subforums from displaying on the board index?
This will remove sub-forums from the drop down list - useful if you have many forums.
Enabling this setting causes the prototype and scriptaculous javascript files to be loaded from Google's servers instead of your own.
You can minify javascript and CSS to reduce the number of HTTP requests to the server, support proper browser caching, and compress the contents sent.
If 'yes', IP.Board will manage your read topics in the database so that they are available on different computers.
Choose how often you'd like for topic markers to be saved back to the DB table. If you choose a time option, the markers information will be saved at session end also.
setting.conf_extra: page=Each Page Load min-1=Every One Minute min-3=Every Three Minutes min-5=Every Five Minutes min-10=Every Ten Minutes session=Session End Only

setting.conf_title_desc: This section contains the date and time formats used throughout the board.

setting.conf_description: If you have chosen the correct timezone and the clock is an hour out, this is because of daylight savings time and your members can correct this by editing their 'Board settings' via their User Control Panel.

You fine tune the server time. If you need to subtract minutes from the server time, start the number with a '-' (no quotes)
Board time (inc. above time zone and current adj.) is now: <-T->
Would use 'today' and 'yesterday' in posts / last post info
setting.conf_extra: 0=No 1=Yes ( Today & Yesterday ) 2=Yes ( Last X Minutes, Today & Yesterday) 3=Yes ( Full, minutes, hours & days )

setting.conf_description: {--} Will be replaced with 'today' or 'yesterday'
When daylight saving time auto-detection is enabled, your member's profiles will be automatically updated with the correct time.
The format here is the same as PHP's strftime
The format here is the same as PHP's strftime
The format here is the same as PHP's strftime
The format here is the same as PHP's strftime
The format here is the same as PHP's strftime

setting.conf_title_desc: This section will allow you to change the incoming and outgoing email addresses as well as the email method.

setting.conf_description: If PHP's mail() isn't available, choose SMTP. If you are unsure, please ask your web host.
This is the email address that all incoming mail is addressed to.
This is the email address that all mail appears to come from.
Default is 'localhost'
Default is 25
Some SMTP mailers require that email addresses are in the following format '<' address '>' (no quotes). If you are getting errors in the mail error log, enabled this option
Not required in most cases when using 'localhost'
Not required in most cases when using 'localhost'
Example: -femail@address.com will force a 'From' header.
You *must* set up a Facebook Application. You can do that here
This is shown after you have created your Facebook Application.
This is shown as "Secret" after you have created your Facebook Application.
Please select the default member group that will be used for all new Facebook created accounts. This does not affect members linking their accounts.

setting.conf_title_desc: These settings control the basics of the board such as URLs and paths.

setting.conf_description: This is the name of the board. It is used as the first link in the navigation menu, etc.
This is the name of your website. If this and "Website Address' is filled in, your website address and name will appear on the board above the header by default.
This is the URL to your website. If entered, it'll appear on the board above the header by default.
The URL to your "uploads" folder. <!--SUGGEST-->

Override the form action for uploads. This is useful in a load-balanced environment to force uploaded files to a specific server. (Most users can leave this blank)
Ex: http://master.mysite.com/forums
This is a path, not a URL. <!--SUGGEST-->

This can be left blank
This is useful for specifing a PATH for the IPB written files (skin_cache, style_avatars, style_emoticons, style_images) when dealing with load balanced/clustered servers. If you enter a PATH, please ensure that it ends with a trailing slash.
Note: This location must have a 'cache' folder. So if you enter /home/path/ then you must have a folder /home/path/cache/

This can be left blank
This can be used if you wish to serve images from a different server or when using clustered servers. Please ensure that you use a trailing slash and that it starts with http(s):// if entering a URL
This controls the debug information shown at the footer of your board.
setting.conf_extra: 0=0: None - Don't show any debug information 1=1: Show server load, page generation times and query count 2=2: Show level 1 (above) and GET and POST information 3=3: Show level 1 + 2 and database queries

setting.conf_description: Would you like to enable the help system in the ACP to provide some additional helpful information?
Removes the board index navigation link when not in the forums application.
If 'yes', this IPB will authenticate against IP.Converge.
The root URL of the converge application.
The product ID assigned from the IP.Converge server

setting.conf_title_desc: This section allows you to manage your copyright removal key.

setting.conf_description: Your copyright removal key obtained from IPS.

setting.conf_title_desc: This section will allow you to edit your IPB registered license settings.

setting.conf_description:
This is the IPB registraton key NOT your customer code or client center password. To get your key, log into your client center and click on 'Invision Power Board' under 'Your Purchases'.
DO NOT REMOVE OR EDIT THIS KEY UNLESS YOU'RE SURE OF WHAT YOU'RE DOING!
If enabled, you can optionally add a "Licensed to" line at the bottom of your board.
Examples: Matthew Mecham, IPS, Inc.
Do you wish to prune spider logs regularly (default every 30 days)?
Do you wish to prune task logs regularly (default every 30 days)?
Do you wish to prune admin logs regularly (default every 30 days)?
Do you wish to prune moderator logs regularly (default every 30 days)?
Do you wish to prune email logs regularly (default every 30 days)?
Do you wish to prune email error logs regularly (default every 30 days)?
Do you wish to prune SQL Error logs older than 30 days?
Prunes admin login logs over configured days.
Prune error logs over 30 days old?
Log all errors over the selected level
setting.conf_extra: 0=Do not log any additional errors 1=Log all errors 2=Log all level 1 errors and above 3=Log all level 2 errors and above 4=Log all level 3 errors and above 5=Log all level 4 errors and above 6=Log all level 5 errors

setting.conf_description: Notify the board incoming email address when an error is logged?
setting.conf_extra: 0=Do not notify of any errors 1=Notify of all errors 2=Notify of all level 1 errors and above 3=Notify of all level 2 errors and above 4=Notify of all level 3 errors and above 5=Notify of all level 4 errors and above 6=Notify of all level 5 errors

setting.conf_title_desc: This section will allow you to set up and maintain your search engine bot spider recognition settings.

setting.conf_title: Enable the search engine spider recognition?
setting.conf_description: If set to "no", this feature will not be activated and all the settings below will have no effect.
If you're under heavy attack, switch this off as it may put a little extra load on the SQL server as it attempts to insert new data rows.

setting.conf_title: Treat spider/bot as part of which group?
setting.conf_description: This is useful as you can specify group settings for a 'bot' group which can restrict access to certain areas, etc.
This is useful as you can create a 'lite' optimized skin for your spiders to use to reduce bandwidth and increase the depth of the bot crawling.

setting.conf_title: Show spider/bot in the active users list?

setting.conf_description: If set to "yes", this makes all spider bots anonymous and they can only be seen by administrators.

setting.conf_title_desc: This section contains settings for your IPB's search system

setting.conf_description: You can use traditional or sphinx searching (if available).
Only applies to traditional search. If you are using traditional search, this is recommended, but may not find non-English words if the database is not configured properly.
Allowing shorter search words can return more results, such as 'if', 'at', etc. Note, if using the fulltext search method, your MySQL configuration may override this setting.

setting.conf_title: Number of search results to show per page
setting.conf_description: Default is 25
Select the forums you don't wish to search for new posts when using either the 'get active topics' or 'view new posts' links. You may select more than one.
If you are using manual search and your SQL server supports fulltext searching, a note is shown on the admin home page. You can manually hide it by changing this to yes.
The address of your Sphinx server, 127.0.0.1 by default.
The port used to connect to your Sphinx server, 3312 by default.
Base path for sphinx indexes and logs

setting.conf_title_desc: These options allow you to adjust the security and privacy options for your board.

setting.conf_description: "Completely Automated Public Turing Test to Tell Computers and Humans Apart": forces users to input a random code when registering and changing email address, etc to prevent bot's from spamming the forums.
Please select which CAPTCHA method you'd like to use.
You can configure questions and answers to add a unique challenge system to your registration process. It is difficult for spam bots to bypass this sort of protection.
setting.conf_keywords: captcha spam spambot questions registration security

setting.conf_description: Do you wish to require guests who post (where allowed) to input a code to confirm their post?
If 'yes', the captcha image will use a random font located in the '/public/style_captcha/captcha_fonts' directory.
You can use the popular reCAPTCHA service. You must select it as your bot control option, and input your public API key here. Get an API Key
You can use the popular reCAPTCHA service. You must select it as your bot control option, and input your private API key here. Get an API Key
Select the language to use for reCAPTCHA
setting.conf_extra: en=English nl=Dutch fr=French de=German pt=Portuguese ru=Russian es=Spanish tr=Turkish

setting.conf_description: Which reCAPTCHA theme would you like to use?
If 'yes' users can post links to images that appear to be dynamic urls.

If enabled, this will check the X_FORWARDED_FOR headers to match the user's IP address. This is useful in a intranet situation if the REMOTE_ADDR will be the same across the network. It will also help maintain AOL sessions but can be abused to forge incorrect headers to report an incorrect IP address. If unsure, leave off.
Please choose which lost password method you wish to use. We recommend using 'Email Random Password' as it's the most secure method.
setting.conf_extra: random=Email Random Password choose=Allow User to Enter New Password

setting.conf_description: It is advised that a member's log in key (used in cookies for persistent log in) expires weekly if not used. This increases the security of your board by exposing log in data for a week limiting the time frame a hacker would have to use the key if stolen.
setting.conf_extra: 0=Do not expire (not recommended) 3=Expire after 3 days 7=Expire after 7 days 30=Expire after 30 days

setting.conf_title: Reset member's log in key upon each log in?
setting.conf_description: If 'yes', each successful log in process will reset the member's auth key which is used in cookies as a password. This will make it impossible to remain logged into more than one computer.
Removes inactive sessions over the limit you specify. The lower the number the less chance of a session being hijacked.

setting.conf_title: Match user's IP Address during session validation
setting.conf_description: If 'yes', the IP address of the user must match the one stored in the sessions table for security. Only use 'no' in an intranet environment where many users share the same IP address.

setting.conf_title: Match user's browser during session validation
setting.conf_description: This further reduces the risk of session hijacking and tampering but it does mean that a user will have their session terminated if they use another browser at the same time.

setting.conf_title: Lock user account after how many failed login attempts
setting.conf_description:
How many failed login attempts should a user be allowed before the account is locked?
Tip: Set to 0 to disable

setting.conf_title: Reset failed login attempts after how many minutes
setting.conf_description:
Reset the login attempts after how many minutes?
Tip: Set to 0 to not reset failed login attempts until a succesful login occurs

If an account is locked due to failed login attempts, do you wish for the account to unlock after the defined time period has passed since their failed login attempt?
Tip: Setting this to no will require you to manually unlock accounts under the Management tab

setting.conf_title: Use secure mail form for member to member mails?
setting.conf_description: Hides the email address from other users and prevents email harvesting bots from gathering your members email addresses.
Globally disable flash videos from being used on the site.
Advanced programmers can force images to run as scripts. IPB limits damage by this method however. This should only be disabled as an extreme measure.

setting.conf_title: Remove the ACP link from the board
setting.conf_description: If 'yes', the ACP link will not be displayed in the board header. This is useful if you rename the default 'admin' folder.
This setting forces login requests to the https version of the forums. You MUST first ensure SSL works for your domain (contact your host if unsure).

Make an administrator manually preview all new accounts or make new users validate their email address. If "User then Admin" validation is selected, the user receives a validation email. On successful user validation, the user is entered into the administration approval queue.
setting.conf_extra: admin_user=User then Admin Validation user=User Email Validation admin=Admin Validation 0=None

setting.conf_title: Remove incomplete registration validations after [x] days
setting.conf_description: This will automatically remove all unvalidated members after the number of days you specify. Enter "0" to not automatically remove unvalidated members.

setting.conf_title: Get notified when a new user registers via email?
setting.conf_description: This will send an email to the root administrator when a new user successfully registers on the board.

setting.conf_title: Get notified when a member is flagged for spamming?
setting.conf_description: This will send an email to the root administrator when a moderator flags a member for spamming.

setting.conf_title: When a member is flagged for spamming:
setting.conf_description: Choose what to do when a moderator flags a member for spamming.
setting.conf_extra: none=Do nothing disable=Disable Post/PM permission unapprove=Disable Post/PM and unapprove posts ban=Unapprove posts, empty profile and ban account

setting.conf_title: No. days worth of posts to (un)approve
setting.conf_description: Enter the number of days worth of posts that flagging a member as spam unapproves (if set above). Enter 0 to select all posts.

setting.conf_title: Force guests to log in before allowing access to the board?
setting.conf_description: If set to yes, any guest must either log in or register before they can view the board.
If set to "yes", this will not allow any guests to register an account on your board.
Can be used as a 'hidden' space to emulate registered names - but can cause problems in non Western character sets.

setting.conf_title: Disable 'Report this post to a moderator' link?
setting.conf_description: Removes the ability for your members to report a post.

Make users wait before posting again
Can be left blank for no flood control and does not apply to members which belong to a group that can bypass flood control.

setting.conf_title: Allow users to browse the Active Users list?
setting.conf_description: If set to "yes", members and guests where allowed will be able to determine the whereabouts of each other on the online list. Topics and forums that the viewer doesn't have permission to see are not shown.
Do you wish to disable members' ability to login anonymously?

setting.conf_title: Disable admin groups viewing anonymous online users?
setting.conf_description: Anonymous users have an asterisk after their name

setting.conf_title: Display IPB version on your site?
setting.conf_description: Do you wish to display the version of Invision Power Board you are running in your copyright footer?

setting.conf_title: Disable admin groups viewing online users IP address in online user list?

setting.conf_title_desc: These settings help tailor your output based on your server's settings.

setting.conf_description: This is the "charset" for all ACP and public documents. We strongly recommend UTF-8
This setting is automatically set during installation but you can override the setting here if you wish. Safe mode skins doesn't cache to PHP files and uses the database exclusively.
GZIP enables faster page transfers and lower bandwidth use however some servers are not configured to allow it.
GD is a graphics extension bundled with most PHP installations. Leave it at v2 if you're not sure which version you have installed.
Some NT installations will require this to be turned to 'no'.

(This will stop browsers caching pages)
Note: The previous setting must be enabled for this to have any effect
If set to "yes", this will remove any "Thanks...." redirection pages used to provide feedback to the user on their last action and will simply redirect without showing this page.
Please select the method to use when immediately redirecting a page.
setting.conf_extra: location=HTTP Header Location refresh=Windows Refresh Command html=HTML Meta Redirect

setting.conf_description: If enabled, sockets will be used to GET remote files. Sockets are preferable as they do not have the caching issues other methods have.
The username for any HTTP (.htaccess) authentication for this installation.
The password for any HTTP (.htaccess) authentication for this installation.

setting.conf_title: Redirect to new friendly URL format?
setting.conf_description: If enabled, a user accessing showxxxx=x type links will be automatically redirected to the new URL format.
If enabled, "301 Moved Permanently" response codes will be added to the header when redirecting the user from the old showxxxx=x to the new friendly URL format if you choose to redirect them.

If you're using PHP as an Apache module you can use 'path info' or you can use 'query string' if you're on Windows hosting or using PHP as a CGI module. Not sure?
Use 'query_string'.
If yes, add a file called .htaccess with the following contents.

If a user attempts to access a forum, topic or user (etc) with an incorrect permalink, ordinarily IP.Board will still show the page.
For example:
/forum/2/my-forum (and)
/forum/2/random-text
both show the same page.
You can choose to alter this behaviour.
setting.conf_extra: nothing=Do Nothing meta=Add a robots meta tag with: 'noindex, nofollow' redirect=Redirect to the correct link with a "301" header

setting.conf_title_desc: Use this setting to turn switch your IP.Board online or offline and leave a message for your visitors.

setting.conf_description: The board will still be accessable by those who have permission (settable from the Users & Groups section).

setting.conf_title_desc: Settings to manage your XML-RPC API interface

setting.conf_description: If 'yes' then your API users will be able to use the XML-RPC interface.
Which type of logging do you wish to record? 'All' will record all API access, 'Failed' will only log failed API accesses.
Enter the maximum number of days you wish to keep logs for. For example, if you entered '30' all logs older than 30 days will be removed.
